intro: Strychnos cirrhosa, commonly known as the red sandalwood or red cedar, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy pulp. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
